snippet: During the first weekend in September, day-trippers swarmed the beach in Costa Rica that serves as a nesting ground for olive ridley sea turtles, becoming a cautionary tale for conservationists, not to mention a social media sensation.
abstract: Tourists in Costa Rica flock to Ostional Beach during first weekend in September, disrupting sea turtle nesting; traffic to beach was heavier than usual due to low rainfall that made passage easier.

byline.original: By ELISABETH MALKIN and PAULINA VILLEGAS
byline.contributor: Nicholas St. Fleur contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: During the first weekend in September, day-trippers swarmed the beach in Costa Rica that serves as a nesting ground for olive ridley sea turtles, becoming a cautionary tale for conservationists, not to mention a social media sensation.

headline.main: Tourists Thwart Turtles from Nesting in Costa Rica
headline.print_headline: Costa Rica Re-evaluates After Thwarted Turtle Nesting
